Content: Containers of essential goods are being cleared expeditiously as the trade unions attached to the Customs Department have concluded their trade union action. According to the reports, clearing of more than seven thousand containers have been impeded during last six days in line with the trade union action. The loss caused by the situation exceeds 12 million rupees. Trade unions of the Customs Department say they will work swiftly to recover the damage caused as a result of their action. Meanwhile, container terminal at the Orugodawatta has also returned to normalcy. Our correspondents report that wholesale traders are active in Pettah following the conclusion of the trade union move.
